measured_by: Self-Injurious Thoughts and Behavior Interview-Short Form (SITBI-SF)
justification: The study utilized selected questions from the SITBI-SF to collect information on individuals' history of SIB, distinguishing between suicidal and non-suicidal types.
The PSIS was used to assess the degree of suicidal intent, evaluating three subscales: 'circumstance,' 'subjective feelings,' and 'other risk factors.'
The BDI-II was implemented to assess participants' depression severity over the past two weeks, consisting of 21 items rated on a four-point scale.
The BIS-11 measured three dimensions of impulsivity: 'motor impulsiveness,' 'cognitive impulsiveness,' and 'lack of planning,' with 30 items rated on a four-point scale.
The LS was used to assess the medical lethality of SIB methods by rating the lethality level of participants' last SIB on an ordinal scale ranging from 0 to 8.
The BART task was utilized to evaluate risk decision-making patterns, specifically focusing on reaction times (Pump RT and Cash RT) and learning curves to understand the cognitive processes.
